paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Taiwanese patients, age of onset generally after the 5th decade
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with symptoms including dysphagia and carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS)

functional_data.summary: The A97S variant is associated with distinct clinical features and pathology in ATTRv.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families as it is a known pathogenic variant.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and autopsy findings.
variants.additional_notes: Dysphagia was noted in 53.4% of A97S patients, and CTS was confirmed in 43.3%.
key_quotes: Dysphagia was a distinct symptom in A97S compared to V30M (53.4 vs. 2.0%, P < 0.001).
In A97S, 45 patients (43.3%) had a history of CTS before the onset of length-dependent symptoms by 3 years.

patients.demographics: Japanese patients, late-onset type, age of onset older than 50 years

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is the most common pathogenic variant in Japan.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families as it is a known pathogenic variant.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: V30M has two onset patterns, early- vs. late-onset type.
key_quotes: V30M (p.V50M) is the most common pathogenic variant in Japan.
The onset age of A97S in Taiwan was generally after the 5th decade.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data is based on the detailed clinical and genetic information provided in the paper.
